title: Userlytics Corporation
area_of_expertise: Market Research in the United States
about: We provide qualitative research services for extremely specific and low incidence target demographic populations, anywhere in the world. The service leverages the ubiquity of webcams and the reach and targeting capability of social media and digital networks to provide simultaneous "Video-in-Video" capture of participants (respondents, their context, what they say, and what they see and do). Task, interviews and surveys can involve videos, display ads, social media assets, usability of software user interfaces, landing pages and websites, prototypes, concepts and messaging. This innovative service transforms qualitative research to a home or workplace based simulated lab environment, by compositing a 360 degree view of the participant reaction and interaction with any type of asset, task, questionnaire or concept, whether offline or online in nature. Because of the low barriers to participation, and by combining with customized social and digital media based recruitment, highly specific and low incidence populations can be targeted and tested, within their home or workplace environment, in a fraction of the time and at a fraction of the cost of traditional qualitative research. This eliminates the problems of demographic mismatch, geography, contextual bias, time and cost associated with traditional qualitative testing. title: Michael J. Horton Law Office
area_of_expertise: Customs Law in the United States
about: Practicing Customs and Import law since 1979.     Normal  0     Admitted to Bar in California, 1979; U.S. District Court, Northern District of California, 1979; U.S. Court of International Trade, 1980.  Author: Import and Customs Law Handbook, Quorum Books, Greenwood Publishing Group, Westport, CT, 1992.             Mr. Horton graduated with distinction from Indiana University at Bloomington, Indiana, with a Bachelor of Arts degree in English in 1964.  Subsequent to his graduation, he was elected to the honorary collegiate society, Phi Beta Kappa.             Mr. Horton joined the United States Customs Service as an Import Specialist in August, 1964, which position he held until August, 1966, when he was furloughed to the United States Army.  He served in Vietnam from March 1967 until March 1968.             After his return to the Customs Service in 1968, Mr. Horton was promoted to the position of Import Specialist (Team Leader) and was assigned responsibility for control and duty determinations on synthetic and ornamented wearing apparel.              Mr. Horton completed academic requirements for his Doctor of Jurisprudence at Golden Gate University School of Law in December of 1978 and graduated with Honors in June of 1979.             Since his admission to the State Bar of California in May of 1979, Mr. Horton has engaged full-time in the private practice of Customs Law and related International Trade Law matters.

title: The European-American Business Organization, Inc.
area_of_expertise: Management Consulting in the United States
about: The European-American Business Organization, Inc. (EABO) is a consulting firm specializing in transatlantic business development and international tax services for SMEs and government agencies. It offers a multitude of services such as market entry and expansion strategy, EU compliance (i.e. CE Markings, REACH), early stage venture funding, strategic partner search, international trade show planning, public relations strategies, as well as cross-border tax and legal assistance.One of the major challenges our U.S. customers face regarding their business development in Europe is compliance with EU regulations. REACH (Registration, Evaluation, Authorization and Restriction of Chemical substances) is a European Regulation on chemicals and their safe use. If you export more than one metric ton of chemicals to Europe, then you are required to comply with REACH.Closely related to REACH, the new CLP (Classification, Labeling and Packaging) Regulation incorporates into EU law classification criteria and labeling rules for chemical substances and mixtures. Whether you are a REACH registrant, importer, manufacturer or distributor of chemical substances, you must notify the European Chemical Agency according to the CLP inventory by January 3, 2011 or within one month after you place the substance on the EU market. Regarding REACH and CLP regulations, we assist customers on the following: ? Answer any questions related to REACH and CLP? Updates on the REACH program requirements and modifications to the regulations ? Assist with the registration of your products ? Provide you with our European REACH ?Only Representative? (required for all importers). If you are seeking to address REACH and CLP compliance issues quickly and efficiently, contact EABO today!
